result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricardo M. Briones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution left open; defense has 30 days to request a restitution hearing.  If no hearing, then order will be restitution of $6,595.00 plus restitution surcharge of $659.50 for a total of $7,254.50 as requested by State.  Balance of bond from 14CM196 to be applied to restitution once it has been determined.

**12/14/2015 - JOC amended per restitution hearing held December 2, 2015, defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $6,595.00 plus 10% restitution surcharge of $659.50.
Not ordered to pay DNA surcharge.

No contact with B.S. or residence.

Comply with any assessments, conditions and no contacts per agent.

Compas assessment.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
